bug.short_desc: Support "transform" for IE9 within the JS animation layer

long_desc.thetext:
Using the "scale" or other "transform" attributes together with the JS animation layer would be good improvement. We could then support more animations using the "transform" than fallback to animation "width", "height" and "fontSize".
Only IE 8 has then to use this fallback and this browser will be outdated hopefully soon.

(In reply to comment #0) > Only IE 8 has then to use this fallback and this browser will be outdated > hopefully soon.
It should be IE9.

(In reply to comment #1) > (In reply to comment #0) > > Only IE 8 has then to use this fallback and this browser will be outdated > > hopefully soon. > > It should be IE9.
I meant with "fallback" using e.g. "width" and "height" instead of "scale". So this only applies to IE8.

Added the transform handling to the JavaScript animation layer. Also fixed a quite heavy bug on the way which resulted in wrong computed values in case more than two keyframes were given.
